roleset.name: make angry or worse, anger-inducing, worsening

role.descr: thing getting angry or getting worse

example.name: all args
example.text: Several traders maintained that the Merc's 12-point circuit-breaker aggravated the market slide Oct. 13 by directing additional selling pressure to the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.
example.arg: by directing additional selling pressure to the floor of the New York Stock Exchange.

example.name: no instrument
example.text: The Health Insurance Association of America, an insurers' trade group, acknowledges that stiff competition among its members to insure businesses likely to be good risks during the first year of coverage has aggravated the problem in the small-business market.
example.arg: stiff competition among its members to insure businesses likely to be good risks during the first year of coverage
the problem in the small-business market.

example.name: ARG2 and ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Moreover , by stepping outside the state 's pro-choice tradition , Mr. Courter aggravates fears that he is too conservative as well on more pressing concerns such as auto insurance rates and the environment .
example.arg: by stepping outside the state 's pro-choice tradition
fears that he is too conservative as well on more pressing concerns such as auto insurance rates and the environment

roleset.note: AGGRAVATE-V NOTES: Methinks Mary is a wee bit touchy. (from aggravate.01-v)
AGGRAVATING-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT. (from aggravating.01-j)
